name: Charlestown
remarks: Built on the grounds of the old Indiana Army Ammunition Plant

name: Clifty Falls
remarks: Features a canyon that has daylight only at midday

name: Falls of the Ohio
remarks: Offers views of the Falls of the Ohio and Louisville, Kentucky

name: Fort Harrison
remarks: Built on the site of old Fort Benjamin Harrison

name: Harmonie
remarks: Near historic Rappite and Owenite villages.

name: Indiana Dunes
remarks: Attached to Indiana Dunes National Park.

name: Lincoln
remarks: Across from Lincoln Boyhood National Memorial, it was the last state park established by Richard Lieber.

name: O'Bannon Woods
remarks: Formerly the Wyandotte SRA, renamed in honor of the late Indiana governor Frank O'Bannon.

name: Ouabache
remarks: Name comes from the French spelling of "Wabash"

name: Shades
remarks: Only state park to ever have its own airstrip.

name: Shakamak
remarks: Used to be a strip mine

name: Spring Mill
remarks: Featured a pioneer village, numerous caves, and a memorial to Gus Grissom

name: Turkey Run
remarks: Famous for its sandstone gorges and unique terrain

name: White River
remarks: An urban park in downtown Indianapolis

name: Whitewater Memorial
remarks: Built on land donated by four counties
